definition: Hanyu Pinyin, the romanization system used in the PRC since the 1960s
phonetic letters
to indicate the pronunciation of Chinese characters using Pinyin or Bopomofo etc/phonetic notation/(specifically) Bopomofo (abbr. for 注音符號|注音符号[zhu4 yin1 fu2 hao4])
pronunciation/literary (rather than colloquial) pronunciation of a Chinese character
to spell
phonetic symbol
character with two or more readings
to pronounce a word after mentally processing its spelling/(phonics) blending
international phonetic alphabet
the final of a Chinese syllable (the component of a syllable remaining after removal of the initial consonant, if any, and the tone, e.g. the final of "niáng" is "iang")
new character (in textbook)/character that is unfamiliar or not yet studied
to pronounce/pronunciation/to emit sound
everyday words
Chinese character/CL:個|个[ge4]/Japanese: kanji/Korean: hanja/Vietnamese: hán tự
homophonic characters
consonant/the initial consonant (of a Chinese syllable)
